review_preview: From the moment we stepped inside it was obvious that this was exactly our kind of place - the most hipstery thing I’ve seen yet in Spain. The space is an old hardware store (“ferreteria”) and it’s been converted into a trendy restaurant. The first...
review_full: From the moment we stepped inside it was obvious that this was exactly our kind of place - the most hipstery thing I’ve seen yet in Spain. The space is an old hardware store (“ferreteria”) and it’s been converted into a trendy restaurant. The first room is like Harry Potter’s wand shop - wooden cabinets everywhere accented with all types of shiny hardware, half of the cabinets haphazardly open to reveal colorful bottles of liquor, and a tall wooden rolling ladder to reach them all.  The second room had an entirely different feel - a kitchen with an all-black theme and an antique-style stove. A man sitting at the counter there looked the part, with rounded spectacles, a satin vest, and a mustache like an old time train conductor. A huge modern-style painting hung on the wall behind some tall wooden slab cocktail tables. One room further, where we ate, had an angled wooden panel ceiling and narrow tall tables with glass display-case tops, revealing a treasure trove of hardware and metal trinkets and old receipts.  Every dish was perfectly executed: tuna tartare, octopus, the best croquetas we’ve had yet. And the crowning achievement was a platter of jamón ibérico that we watched being sliced from different sections, after which it was plated beautifully and served with an explanation of the flavors we could expect from each. There was also a pisco sour involved and a chocolate mousse that we all shared, and the whole experience was so sumptuous that it was painful to leave.  FYI - we came early before 8pm so it was easy to get a table without a reservation in their upstairs dining room, but be aware that they also have a downstairs dining room with a bigger menu and it would be wise to book that far in advance!

title_review: IF YOU WANT TO EXPERIENCE JAMÓN IN ANOTHER LEVEL
review_preview: I went to Ferretería for a family & friends lunch on a Sunday. I had a few recommendations from some friends so I knew it was going to be ok, but I was not sure that was going to be enough not to disappoint my...
review_full: I went to Ferretería for a family & friends lunch on a Sunday. I had a few recommendations from some friends so I knew it was going to be ok, but I was not sure that was going to be enough not to disappoint my dad... We entered and the place is already surprisingly cool, we had some vermuts there and then we went downstairs to eat. A very nice waitress gave us a tour around the spectacular place, filled with art pieces. And then the magic: we ordered the "Jamón experience", I wouldn't call it a plate, that lovely Fernando created and walked us through it. Now seriously, I'm from Spain, I eat jamón very often and so does my dad, who actually has a little obsession with it, and this was nothing like we tasted before. There was maybe a surprise factor, but I don't think anybody would not be suprised by this. And then the cecina was awesome, the croquetas and the El Capricho meat were also very good, but man! Than jamón!!

review_preview: For two we ate the following:1 Temaki de Toro Picante      very subtle and not  spicy as the title suggested. Excellent1 Gunkan of Sea Urchin         very good, though sea urchin does have a strange taste2 Butterfish Nigiri                    would have preferred if served cooler...
review_full: For two we ate the following: 1 Temaki de Toro Picante very subtle and not spicy as the title suggested. Excellent 1 Gunkan of Sea Urchin very good, though sea urchin does have a strange taste 2 Butterfish Nigiri would have preferred if served cooler than room temperature 2 Scallop Nigiri same comment as Butterfish 1 Seaweed with sesame excellently seasoned and interesting to the last delicate mouthful! 3 Salmon eggs and avocado cones we had one each and it was so good that I reordered 2 Flying fish egg Gunkan really scrunchy eggs and when eaten with accompaniment an . explosion of taste in the mouth. We drank a bottle of rosé cava and a bottle of water and total bill was 112€ which I thought was money well spent. The decoration is minimalist in tones of grey and black. Tables are fairly close together but everyone behaved themselves and ate fairly quietly: quite an exploit for Spain.   Service was friendly and generally efficient, although a bit quircky to start with. We were initially the only customers. When asked if we wanted an aperitive I said no, but I'd like to see the wine list straight away. The staff chatted among themselves and the wine list took well over five minutes to travel as many meters. The cava was duly opened and poured and we had started to drink it when two complimentary gin tonics turned up. Very kind, but we'd have preferred the GT's before opening and starting the wine!   The piped music was a little strange at first: modern crooner versions of songs that should have been left well alone (a remake of a Beatles hit in crooner style, I think it was" Daytripper", was particularly unfortunate). The restaurant filled up very discreetly and we had a most enjoyable evening, especially because the "music" had been turned down to a more acceptable volume (it was never blaring but nonetheless a little intrusive at the start). Customers seemed to be very happy with their choice of restaurant and food, leading to a nice "warm" ambiance. We didn't bother with a dessert as what we had eaten was quite enough...and we are enthusiastic eaters! The restaurant has an extensive wine list with prices for most pockets. We live in Madrid and will certainly return.

Go here, you won't be disappointed, but check the prices in advance they're a little higher than the experience justifies I think.

review_preview: This restaurant is a fantastic example of how eating out should be. Fantastic and attentive service, good quality food, recommendations that hit the spot, all added to by a very good wine list to suit all sorts of budgets. I was initially a bit put...
review_full: This restaurant is a fantastic example of how eating out should be. Fantastic and attentive service, good quality food, recommendations that hit the spot, all added to by a very good wine list to suit all sorts of budgets.  I was initially a bit put off by the fact that it’s inside a hotel chain, but I needn’t have been. It was quite hard to get a booking at short notice, and understandably so as the whole experience was without flaw. There was a wide variety of sushi (thankfully much more than the tuna and salmon only options that so many sushi restaurants in Madrid have), the fish was fresh and succulent, the shrimp tempura to die for.  This restaurant has definitely been added to my list of favourites!

title_review: Literally the best meal of my life!
review_preview: I wouldn't ever thinking about having sushi in Spain. And I spent the other 12 meals of my trip enjoying tapas! However my partner had visited 99 sushi on a business trip and insisted he take me there..... I am so glad he did! We...
review_full: I wouldn't ever thinking about having sushi in Spain. And I spent the other 12 meals of my trip enjoying tapas! However my partner had visited 99 sushi on a business trip and insisted he take me there..... I am so glad he did! We didn't book but we're lucky enough to get a table there and then with some lovely staff who were very kind and accommodating with my bad use of Spanish! We started with the best miso soup I've ever had, I think it had truffle in it and was delicious! Then we splashed out a little and had fatty tuna sashimi and mixed maki. It was incredible! Melt in your mouth good! We were full but we saw the table next to us have a lobster dish.... we had to have it! The lobster maki was out of this world and literally the best meal I have ever had. I have travelled the world and spent a lot of time in Japan and this is where I had the best sushi! It's not the cheapest meal you'll have, however the service is great and the food exceeds all expectations. Certainly worth the price! Make sure you book a table here when you visit Madrid!

title_review: Food is 5 star, but it's Expensive
review_preview: I've been wanting to try this place for a couple years now. I knew we would be in the neighborhood for a weekday lunch, so we made reservations on their website.  The place is very nice, modern and upscale (if not a bit stuffy).  Most...
review_full: I've been wanting to try this place for a couple years now. I knew we would be in the neighborhood for a weekday lunch, so we made reservations on their website. The place is very nice, modern and upscale (if not a bit stuffy). Most of the clientele were in business suits, and the wait staff mirrors that - they are very serious and professional. We split 3 beers (Kirin on draft), a large bottle of water, a seaweed & cucumber salad, the signature shrimp tempura, two rolls and two cups of coffee. A small plate of edamame was presented without cost. Everything was excellent, the shrimp tempura (though not typical) was amazing. The quality of their seafood is very high and the serving sizes are decent. I would definitely put this on our list of highly frequented restaurants if it wasn't so expensive. We spent 105 euro for our light lunch, but we could have easily spent twice that if we had ordered their recommended 'bar menu' and a bottle of wine. I'm glad we went and I would highly recommended it for anyone who loves Japanese food. Overall, it's a great place to go for a special occasion (or if your company is picking up the tab).

review_preview: A good friend of mine, who loves food and especially Japanese food, recommended to me this restaurant. Thank to the concierge of my hotel, I was able to get a reservation but at the bar which was even better as you can see the whole...
review_full: A good friend of mine, who loves food and especially Japanese food, recommended to me this restaurant. Thank to the concierge of my hotel, I was able to get a reservation but at the bar which was even better as you can see the whole preparation. I had the tiger prawn tempura, the nigiri butterfish with truffle (so good), the mini wagsu burger, Nigiri de salmón flambeado con lima, toro flambeado con tomate... everything was a pure delight with a special mention for the Nigiri flambeado. It's pricey (90 Euros per person including a glass of wine) but quality has no price and you will not be disappointed. A great experience with excellent service. Intimate place. Cannot wait to return. They have 4 different places (restaurants in Madrid) and the one in Hermosilla is always fully booked. Therefore, do make reservation !

review_full: We visited the outlet of this small chain that's located at Pozano, 99 - convenient to the Nuevos Ministerios transportation complex. As Spain is second only to Japan in fish consumption (and variety) it has a number of good sushi bars/Japanese and Japanese style restaurants, and the 99 Group is in their upper ranks. Their Maki sampler (2 pieces each of four different Maki rolls) is very well presented and an interesting, and attractive, variation on this traditional fare. The shrimp and vegetable tempura was perfectly done, as was the toro sushi. There is a good wine list, reasonably priced. We arrived around 11 pm on a quiet weeknight, and found the restaurant about half full. The service was prompt, but not pretentious. The decor is modern, but doesn't get in the way of the dining experience. A good choice if you're in the area (it's not in the more tourist-populated parts of Madrid).

title_review: If you like fusion sushi, don't miss this one
review_preview: This is a Japanese restaurant, but with a fusion touch. They take classical dishes and give them a Spanish touch. The combination is sublime for my taste. It is quite similar to Kabuki in my opinion.We arrived early, and chose to sit in the...
review_full: This is a Japanese restaurant, but with a fusion touch. They take classical dishes and give them a Spanish touch. The combination is sublime for my taste. It is quite similar to Kabuki in my opinion. We arrived early, and chose to sit in the bar, watching the sushi chefs work. I would recommend doing this, specially if you are 3 people or less, as it really gives another dimension to the meal, watching how they skillfully prepare the food. We started with the miso soup, which had some truffle on it. Very tasty. The usuzukuri was very interesting as well, as you could see the mixture of traditional sashimi and spanish flavors working really well. Then we had mostly nigiris. All of them were excellent. Personally, I really liked the sardine and anchovy combo, the butterfish with truffle and the scallop, but you cannot really go wrong with anything else. From previous visits I remember the tiger prawn tempura fondly. The service is outstanding and very professional.

When we ordered our first drink, We got free large prawns and mussels. When I told the waiter that my wife was allergic to prawns, he brought her free fried fish. We ordered 3 main courses with Tuna, fish and Ham with a bottle of their Rioja. For 15 Euros for the wine, it was very good. After the meal, when I tipped the waiter 5 Euros, he asked us to wait ant poured large glasses of the same wine free, with more tapas. Imagine that in London. Highly recommended.

I had my confirmation and locator number but he kept telling me no... Then another waiter came over and said " just give me 10 minutes and we will seat you" ... He was true to his word, and I am so grateful because we had a excellent meal and time at La Castela. We ordered a great bottle of wine with our sautéed chick pea with king prawns ... Then we had a order of Sea Bream and Monk fish, both just perfect.  We had a lovely time, wonderful meal. So don't let the bar fool you... There is a lovely place behind the door!

The staff are ultimate professionals. Our visit will be remembered for all the right reasons for long time.

review_preview: The food in Madrid is absolutely fantastic on the whole however in our week long stay we found we ate so much meat, seafood, cheese and bread. We where perusing the vintage shops of Malasaña and Chueco when we stumbled across this little vegan place....
review_full: The food in Madrid is absolutely fantastic on the whole however in our week long stay we found we ate so much meat, seafood, cheese and bread. We where perusing the vintage shops of Malasaña and Chueco when we stumbled across this little vegan place. As a veggie in a previous life of six years I'm not scared of a veggie or vegan haunt and neither is my carnivorous GF. What we ate in this beautifully quaint eatery was fantastic. Simple and tasty and unbelievably fresh. The lady who served us was undoubtedly one of the friendliest people we encountered on our trip. She spoke excellent English and was warm and accommodating. If you want a change of scene from the meat sweats, this is the place. If your vegan, it's a must.

review_preview: If you've been living in Madrid for a while, you know that it has a huge range of wonderful food to offer. However, hummus has never been one of them - until now! After trying hummus in both Spanish and Middle Eastern (and even Moroccan)...
review_full: If you've been living in Madrid for a while, you know that it has a huge range of wonderful food to offer. However, hummus has never been one of them - until now! After trying hummus in both Spanish and Middle Eastern (and even Moroccan) restaurants as well as any kind of supermarkets, I had almost given up on finding a decent version of this dish in Madrid. Nevertheless, on a day like any other, I stumbled upon La Hummuseria entirely by chance. Based on my previous experience and seeing how the place was completely empty even at lunch time was not very promising, but my curiosity got the best of me and I decided to try some of their hummus. Little did I know that it would completely blow my mind. From the first bite, I was hooked and couldn't quite believe my taste buds. This was the best hummus I had tried since I left the Middle East (which is indeed saying something). As if that wasn't enough, the bread that came with it was also pretty good. And, perhaps most surprising of all, was the fact that the staff were also nice, smiling and helpful (another rarity in Madrid). For this reason, I am absolutely certain that La Hummuseria will be able to revolutionize both food and service in Madrid. My only regret? I wish it would have happened sooner!

review_preview: La Hummusería is a wonderful restaurant situated not far from the lively areas of Alonso Martínez and Chueca.It offers some of the best hummus dishes and salads I have come across so far in the Spanish capital, which come as a welcome healthier change...
review_full: La Hummusería is a wonderful restaurant situated not far from the lively areas of Alonso Martínez and Chueca. It offers some of the best hummus dishes and salads I have come across so far in the Spanish capital, which come as a welcome healthier change from some of the more hearty (and heavy) traditional Spanish gastronomy. As much as I enjoyed my meal here (very much), the customer service didn't quite match the food. I went with a group to celebrate a wedding and despite our booking, the staff were not accommodating whatsoever when it came to rearranging a more appropriate table arrangement. Furthermore, I warn you to watch your belongings during your meal! I regrettably had my backpack stolen at some point, distracted by the amount of deliverymen continually entering and leaving the restaurant. Nevertheless, I definitely recommend this restaurant and just hope nothing goes wrong for you!

review_preview: I left this restaurant full of delicious vegetarian food and feeling full with joy too! It's been around a week since I ate at this hummus heaven and I still find myself day dreaming about the amazzzing food.A lovely little find, along a quiet...
review_full: I left this restaurant full of delicious vegetarian food and feeling full with joy too!  It's been around a week since I ate at this hummus heaven and I still find myself day dreaming about the amazzzing food. A lovely little find, along a quiet street in the area of Chueca, my friends and I almost walked right past it. The design of the interior is bright and colourful which adds to the friendly atmosphere, along with the lovely staff members who went through the menu with us. My friends and I chose the menu of the day, which consisted of a homemade drink (lemonade/iced tea), a starter (we chose caramelised pear with rocket and goats cheese), hummus of your choice (garlic, chile/mushroom and more!) with warm pitta bread, and if that wasn't enough, a desert (I had homemade banana and chocolate cake with blueberries and raspberries). All for ONLY 10 EUROS!! Such a good value for the quality and quantity of food you get. Considering we had to take our deserts home in a box because we had no room left in our stomachs, says a lot!  I would recommend this lovelyy place to anybody (especially hummus lovers). I went on a weekday around 15:00 and it was half full, but with plenty of costumers in and out of the door as we were there. I can imagine it gets pretty busy at the weekends.  I will definitely return here, very soon!

title_review: One of the best restaurants in historical Madrid
review_preview: Spaniards are very fond of specialties like "Cochinillo" - a roasted piglet - or "Corderito al horno" - young roasted lamb, and there are many restaurants in Madrid as well as all over Spain, and especially in Segovia - which offer such delicacies.Having said...
review_full: Spaniards are very fond of specialties like "Cochinillo" - a roasted piglet - or "Corderito al horno" - young roasted lamb, and there are many restaurants in Madrid as well as all over Spain, and especially in Segovia - which offer such delicacies. Having said this, I must state that this tiny restaurant, located in the pictoresque center of old Madrid, is one of the best places to enjoy the superb food, an excellent service, in a cozy and elegant ambience.  It is moderately expensive and truly recommendable.

title_review: the best place in Madrid for asado castellano
review_preview: The Pedrusco de Aldeacorvo is the best restaurant in Madrid for asado castellano, in particular, cochinillo (oven-roasted sucking pig) and cordero lechal (oven-roasted suckling lamb).  The  grandfather of Antonio, the current owner, brought the now more-than-one-hundred-year-old, wood-fired, clay oven from Segovia,  If you want to...
review_full: The Pedrusco de Aldeacorvo is the best restaurant in Madrid for asado castellano, in particular, cochinillo (oven-roasted sucking pig) and cordero lechal (oven-roasted suckling lamb). The grandfather of Antonio, the current owner, brought the now more-than-one-hundred-year-old, wood-fired, clay oven from Segovia, If you want to have cochinillo or cordero, you should call at least a couple of hours ahead of time, and Antonio and his team will cook it especially for you. The Pedrusco de Aldeacorvo has an extensive menu, but my advice is simple: Order some cochinillo and/or cordero with some potatoes and/or salad on the side; get some of the excellent red wine to wash it done; and you are set. If you are with a good group of family or friends, you can spend a wonderful afternoon in a beautiful but comfortable setting with excellent and friendly service.

review_preview: This is a very small restaurant,  4-5 tables, with a maximum capacity of around 12 people, and the entire staff are owners Estela who runs the front, and chef Giuseppe.  The menu is limited given the size of the place, but Giuseppe greets each table,...
review_full: This is a very small restaurant, 4-5 tables, with a maximum capacity of around 12 people, and the entire staff are owners Estela who runs the front, and chef Giuseppe. The menu is limited given the size of the place, but Giuseppe greets each table, explains what is best that day, and we listen to his advice, which ends up being some of the best Italian food we have ever had. The pasta and seafood is fresh, and Giuseppe is a maestro with sauces. He admits his tiramisu is not the best in the world, though it is the best is Spain, and I think he may be right. My family has eaten here around 5 times, mostly because of how good the food is, but also because of the vibe. It's like you are in the house of a couple for dinner. More than once we have had to shift tables mid-meal to accommodate another party, and others have done the same for us. When we order wine, it's red or white, not a carta de vino, but the wine is good! When it gets hectic Estella and Giuseppe have been known to spar with each other a bit, not unlike what would happen at my house! So, if you are looking for some of the best Italian food in Madrid, and like an intimate, casual and unique environment, and like to get to know the owners, this is a good place for you. A few words of advice, based on experience and other reviews. Make reservations directly, I use email, though whatsapp works, and confirm them. I know on one occasion they misplaced our reservation, but we were there early and they seated us, and another party who came in later could not be accommodated (I think there is a review out here from that person). Also, they really only can fit around 12 people max, maybe 2 parties of 4, and a party of 5-6 is tough to fit, so if you are that size, reserve much more in advance. It will be worth it.

title_review: Artichoke dish was one of the best starters I've ever had...
review_preview: I really enjoyed this restaurant.  I went early - 9pm - so had the full attention of the host, who made great recommendations.  The artichoke dish was fantastic - I believe it had porcini mushrooms and foie gras.  Whatever the mix, all flavors went exceptionally...
review_full: I really enjoyed this restaurant. I went early - 9pm - so had the full attention of the host, who made great recommendations. The artichoke dish was fantastic - I believe it had porcini mushrooms and foie gras. Whatever the mix, all flavors went exceptionally together. The gambas al ajillo was great - the shrimps were a bit sweet (naturally, not from sugar) and very tender. The roast suckling pig was simply seasoned, but a very basic lettuce tomato & onion salad combined with it made these two dishes really come to life. It was nice to be able to order 1 ration of the pig, whereas normally restaurants seem to require orders for 2 or more. We finished off the meal with the Pincho Segovia cake, which was one of the best desserts I've had in some time.  The restaurant ambience is very nice - it has been renovated fairly recently, but with antique elements to its decor, it retains an older regal charm.

title_review: I’m still dreaming of this meal! Quaint and delicious
review_preview: We stumbled upon this restaurant. I was craving pasta and we wanted to get away from the more tourist restaurants in Madrid. We stopped a local and they recommended this place. Best meal we had in our entire trip in Spain! I could go on...
review_full: We stumbled upon this restaurant. I was craving pasta and we wanted to get away from the more tourist restaurants in Madrid. We stopped a local and they recommended this place. Best meal we had in our entire trip in Spain! I could go on about how every dish was so incredibly delicious, how the pasta was mouthwateringly fantastic or how we still talk about how amazing it was, but the best part was how proud the chef was of his food and it clearly showed. He came to our table to talk about the specials, his favourite dishes and to show us the fresh seafood brought in that day. We were entertained and amazed to watch him cook every meal from scratch in his kitchen. The meal was a true reflection of his passion and understanding for cuisine and unexpected combinations (pappardelle with salmon and strawberry pasta - amazing). Definitely get the mussels for a starter and truffle pasta for dinner. I’d fly to Spain just to eat there again.

title_review: Not nearly as good as our previous visit
review_preview: My husband and I returned to Hortensio for dinner based on the great experience we had two years ago.  We requested and received a table with a view of the kitchen.  We were served a complimentary pre-meal "appetizer" and it was beautifully presented and delicious....
review_full: My husband and I returned to Hortensio for dinner based on the great experience we had two years ago. We requested and received a table with a view of the kitchen. We were served a complimentary pre-meal "appetizer" and it was beautifully presented and delicious. For the first course we split the Bogavante Azul, a lobster dish, and it was delicious. For the second course we decided to split the Cochinillo (suckling pig). We asked for one dish to split but were served two separate orders. This is a misunderstanding that we could accept because perhaps the waiter did not understand my husband's Spanish, although he specifically said "una ración para compartir" (one portion to share). The cochinillo was surprisingly dry and the sauce that came with it was on the salty side and of insufficient quantity. This is no doubt Hortensio's version of cochinillo, and I must say my husband and I both much prefer the traditional style, moist and served in its own juices. One irritating thing was the fact that the wine server wiped off the top of the bottle with her bare hand after each pouring, and we observed that she did this at all tables. To my way of thinking this is an unsanitary practice. I would suggest that as we have observed at all other fine dining establishments they use a napkin to wipe off the bottle. All in all, some very good, some not so good at this meal.

review_preview: Spaniards love to dine late in the evening so when an American couple kept their reservation at 9pm we were the sole guests in this truly beautiful restaurant.  What a fine reception we received!  This is an elegant small restaurant which seats no more than...
review_full: Spaniards love to dine late in the evening so when an American couple kept their reservation at 9pm we were the sole guests in this truly beautiful restaurant. What a fine reception we received! This is an elegant small restaurant which seats no more than 35 people. The ambiance is sophisticated from the all white flowers, flickering candle light and beautiful table settings to the attentions of the sommelier and the wait staff. A fine air of anticipation for a lovely dining experience prevails! The chef trained in Lyon and chatted with us about our visit to Madrid. His tall toque represents his great skill in the kitchen. He manages to combine lovely sauces with the meats and poultry dishes of Spain. There is an open kitchen so it is possible to observe the great care that these beautiful dishes require. What a fine kitchen he runs. The sommelier and the wait staff were quietly attentive, gracious and kind with just a soupcon of good humor to guide us through our evening. Please do visit this gracious restaurant when you are in Madrid. From the first glass of Cava to the last drop of Grappa you will spend a delightful evening.

review_preview: It is not easy to describe what a delight is to find this gem in Madrid. It is the equivalent of finding a pearl in an oyster. Small, cozy, tastefully decorated, Hortensio is exactly what a very high level gourmet experience should be: relatively small...
review_full: It is not easy to describe what a delight is to find this gem in Madrid. It is the equivalent of finding a pearl in an oyster. Small, cozy, tastefully decorated, Hortensio is exactly what a very high level gourmet experience should be: relatively small choice of exquisite plates where the chef can supervise personally each plate. We had several starters, in which the 'carpaccio' of sea bass and the wild mushrooms were exquisite. As a main course we had ox tail, squid, and sole, all them outstanding. We closed a remarkable dinner with some of the finest desserts we have had in Spain. Staff was courteous and attentive to our every need and we washed dinner with a great Rosé. The sherry on top was the talking to the chef after dinner about the plates we had recently eaten!

review_full: Booked this restaurant on the strength of other reviews and was not disappointed. We got there by metro, it is situated in a very pleasant residential area. It didn't open until 20.30 so we booked for then but by the time we left the restaurant was full so booking seems essential. We were greeted courteously by the maitre d and shown to our table right by the kitchen so we saw everything that went on. When they found out we were english another waiter appeared who spoke excellent English we ordered a dry sherry as an aperitif and browsed the menu. The smoked egg dish is unusual and delicious, I followed that with the loin of venison, cooked to perfection,my partner had the eggs too followed by the steak which was equally delicious. Sweets and coffee followed and we left feeling very satisfied after a delicious meal in lovely surroundings, cannot recommend highly enough.

review_preview: My husband and I, together with one of my brothers and another couple had one of the finest meals in Madrid. Chef Mario Valles just opened his first restaurant and we reckon this will be the MUST place to go for a great gastronomic experience....
review_full: My husband and I, together with one of my brothers and another couple had one of the finest meals in Madrid. Chef Mario Valles just opened his first restaurant and we reckon this will be the MUST place to go for a great gastronomic experience. Place was renovated with great style, taste and it has a really warm and elegant ambiance. Excellent starters, main courses, desserts and perfect wine selection. We started with Foie Gras; Esparragos con Salsa Vierge, Oysters Guillardeau. Some of the dishes are preparared with a twist of latin flavours. Exquisite main courses: Pichon Frances (to die for); Paleta de Cordero en Baja Coccion; Solomillo de Cerdo Iberico and Merluza con puerros y Agua de mar. All Delightful. As desserts, we had Sufle de Turron con helado de Chocolate Blanco y Maracuya and Tarta Fina de Manzana.  Worth every Euro spent for the quality of meal we had. Perfect composition results in a truly perfect gastronomic experience!!

One of the most pleasant dining experiences in some years. A bill of slightly over €70 per person was gladly paid.

review_preview: We were only in Madrid for 48 hours and it was our first visit (we will be back). This restaurant was within easy walking distance of our hotel. What a treat it turned out to be; fabulous food, excellent wine and great service. We only...
review_full: We were only in Madrid for 48 hours and it was our first visit (we will be back). This restaurant was within easy walking distance of our hotel. What a treat it turned out to be; fabulous food, excellent wine and great service. We only had 2 courses as that was enough so we can't comment on the desserts...maybe next time. It was a Tuesday night and the place was busy, clearly the restaurant already has a reputation. The highlight for me on the food front was the Huevo Ahumado (a starter) - one of the best things I've eaten in a long time and we've been eating in some excellent places. A final flourish was the chief chef (the owner?) rushed out as we were leaving to check how much we'd enjoyed dinner and left us with an !Hasta Luego!

review_preview: This restaurant is beautifully furnished and provides a classy dining experience.  The front of house staff were absolutely on their game.  They elect to remove your wine and water bottles from the table and pour when they see that you require a top up.  This...
review_full: This restaurant is beautifully furnished and provides a classy dining experience. The front of house staff were absolutely on their game. They elect to remove your wine and water bottles from the table and pour when they see that you require a top up. This can only work where the waiting staff pay attention and we have been in some Michelin starred premises where we have to repeatedly ask a waiter for more water or wine. However, this was never a problem in Hortensio where the waiters were almost telepathic in their vigilance. As an aside, the napkins were the largest we have ever seen, verging on bedsheet size. As a messy eater I liked this. Now, the food - this was outstanding and delivered an intensity of flavour that we have seldom previously found. Every dish bore the hallmark of a chef at the top of his form - imaginative, creative and with ingredients of premier quality. If you are in Madrid, don't miss it.

title_review: Superb Quality; my new fave in Madrid!
review_preview: I visited Hortensio for the second time and I was equally pleased and impressed as the first, a couple of months ago. Everything we had was a delight of the senses: starters and main courses alike. High quality food, yet simple but superbly executed. I...
review_full: I visited Hortensio for the second time and I was equally pleased and impressed as the first, a couple of months ago. Everything we had was a delight of the senses: starters and main courses alike. High quality food, yet simple but superbly executed. I like the tables in front of the open kitchen area where one can see the work made in the preparation of the plates, everything is so tasteful and designed to perfection! And the atmosphere is relaxed and cozy, where one can talk without an effort. A very good idea to serve the ice-cream in a semi-freddo state , not too cold and very creamy: it lets out the best of its taste! Congratulations to the Chef, Mario Vallés!! I hope to be back soon!

title_review: Good for a Monday evening; but there are better
review_preview: I went to Hortensio for a Monday evening business dinner, always a bit of a challenge in Madrid since many good restaurants shut Mondays. It's a small place on a side street, quite intimate, but works well for business, you can hear each other talk...
review_full: I went to Hortensio for a Monday evening business dinner, always a bit of a challenge in Madrid since many good restaurants shut Mondays. It's a small place on a side street, quite intimate, but works well for business, you can hear each other talk and you aren't TOO close to the next table.  I ate "hunter's rice" (arroz de caza) followed by turbot. The rice was excellent, would love to eat it again. The turbot was good but perhaps a little bland and for my taste SLIGHTLY overcooked (I'm being picky). The service was very deferential but inaccurate, they weren't 100% on remembering who ordered what. Which surprised me since front of house were all men of a certain age who you'd figure must be experienced waiters.  Hortensio was fine but competition in this town is intense and you can usually do better than "fine."

review_preview: This is the best restaurant I have eaten at in Madrid. The food is wonderful and the staff is extremely nice. The room is very peaceful. It really was a great evening. The menu sounds very simple but the complexity of flavors and cooking was...
review_full: This is the best restaurant I have eaten at in Madrid. The food is wonderful and the staff is extremely nice. The room is very peaceful. It really was a great evening. The menu sounds very simple but the complexity of flavors and cooking was a surprise. The 2 of us had five different dishes and an amuse of melon salad. Everyone delicious. The chef Mario Vallés somehow is able to take Spanish dishes and ingredients and give them a new life. If you look at the pictures online you can see how beautiful the food is but the taste is even better. A fish dish was so fresh and cooked so delicate I don’t know how he did it. And don’t skip desert. We had been traveling around Spain for weeks, even eating in some very famous restaurants and still Hortensio was the best meal. Can’t wait to go back.

The menu is focused on a few well conceived and executed dishes designed to give a Spanish culinary journey. We had an consommé infused foie open ravioli that was divine followed by a sea bass carpaccio that was flavorful and melt in your mouth. The main courses selections were squid, pigeon and lamb. I had the lamb which had captured the wood fired flavor intimately and was accompanied with a wine based sauce that complemented the wood flavors beautifully. My companions had the squid with carmelized squid ink which was as tender a squid I have ever had. We finished with panna cotta brioche that finished the evening wonderfully. Great wine selection. I would recommend this restaurant for a business or romantic evening.

title_review: The kitchen in the dining area!!
review_preview: It is a nice idea to arrange for the final phase of the dish preparation directly into the dining area, where the chef assembles the courses and has them ready to be eaten.Hortensio is an elegant restaurant fitting for business and formal/important occasions with...
review_full: It is a nice idea to arrange for the final phase of the dish preparation directly into the dining area, where the chef assembles the courses and has them ready to be eaten. Hortensio is an elegant restaurant fitting for business and formal/important occasions with a nice atmosphere in a beautiful area of Madrid. Not a wide choice of dishes but those we tried were very well made, with a modern touch and a valid presentation. The chef (Mario, a young, modest and very gentle guy who also owns the restaurant) went around the tables to talk to the guests at the end of the service. We appreciated it. The bill was not for all pockets (around 80 euros per person for 2 appetizers, 2 main courses, 2 desserts and 4 glasses of champagne), which is a bit too high for what we had (65 Euro would have been more appropriate), also considering the average prices in Madrid. In any case, if you are looking for a good combination of delicious food and elegant atmosphere, this is the right place for you. Worth a visit.

title_review: Good food and service, not fantastic
review_preview: As I have read in other reviews, this place is by no means poor, but it lacks a "je ne sais quoi" to be great.The local is very nicely done, great brick walls nice wooden floors tables are impeccable.The service is good, I...
review_full: As I have read in other reviews, this place is by no means poor, but it lacks a "je ne sais quoi" to be great. The local is very nicely done, great brick walls nice wooden floors tables are impeccable. The service is good, I have had better and much worse. Food is good but not great, normally I would be happy but when you consider the price of the food, it throws me off. Personally I had the egg yolk with a corn souffle as a first plate, then I had the lb as a main. The egg was not at all special, heavy and the tastes did not blend well.  The lamb was good in taste but slightly over done and needed a bit more flavor. Some colleagues who ordered the Salomonete (red mullet) said the taste was fantastic but the supposed de-boned fish was not really deboned. I would not return, hence my three star rating.

review_preview: How happy was I to see a craft beer bar open a 10 minute walk from my house?!? El Sainete is located in the building that for years was the Egyptian restaurant, El Faraon and since then has undergone at least 3 "reincarnations"; all of...
review_full: How happy was I to see a craft beer bar open a 10 minute walk from my house?!? El Sainete is located in the building that for years was the Egyptian restaurant, El Faraon and since then has undergone at least 3 "reincarnations"; all of them failing miserably. Lets make one thing clear immediately. This is a Mahou brewpub. That sentence alone will send a shudder down the spine of most self-respecting craft beer lovers. In Mahou's strong desire to get a foothold in that market they've bought stakes in Michigan-based brewery, Founders and Spanish brewery, Nomada. Of the 20 beers on offer, 10 are from those two breweries while the other 10 are rotated with guest beers. The beers that I've tried in two separate visits have been excellent. Clean, fresh and full of flavour. Cheaper than several bars in Madrid and certainly cheaper than in Barcelona. Expect to pay around €5.50-€6.00 for most American pint measures. The most disappointing aspect for me was the lack of other drinkers. And I mean lack. In fact, no one. Last Friday night for 2 hours I sat alone while 5 bar staff amused themselves and engaged in group thumb-twiddling. The same on my first visit, a Sunday evening. Many bars faced with this lack of custom would no doubt close down but Mahou have clearly put alot of money into this project installing digital beer menus that can be downloaded to a smartphone and downstairs a restaurant serving "alta cocina". I still harbour major doubts that the average craft drinker finds this kind of gastronomic adventure interesting. So all in all, a risky first toe-dip by Mahou into the brewpub market. In my opinion they've chosen a poor location with a history of failure and the food is not going to entice people like me who much prefer a good spicy burrito or pulled pork cob to go with a pint. I'm sure with Mahou's enormous resources this bar can cling to life longer than most but the early signs dont auger well.

The meal was absolutely divine. For starters- grilled vegetables with a lovely tender spicy sauce, entrees were the sirloin that was so tender it practically melted in one's mouth. The salmon with potatoes sounds very Californian but the flavors were very Spanish. We're so very sorry to have not remembered the Crianza we had with lunch. It was very good. For dessert we baked broiche with gelato and assorted cookies. The waitstaff was attentive and accommodating and very professional. We highly recommend Hortensio for a special meal in Madrid. Make reservations - this place is very popluar.

review_preview: My husband and I had dinner here in September, 2016.  This restaurant has one Michelin star.  It should have three!!  The service was impecable. Our waiter served everything with the exact timing we requested, and with a smile!! They gave us some ajo blanco (a...
review_full: My husband and I had dinner here in September, 2016. This restaurant has one Michelin star. It should have three!! The service was impecable. Our waiter served everything with the exact timing we requested, and with a smile!! They gave us some ajo blanco (a white gazpacho) to start the meal and it was delicious. Indeed, everything we had was delicious. We first had Pluma Iberica which is a cut of meat from the black pig fed on acorns. You would not know the meat was pork. Tasted like beef, only better. The sauce it came with was also delicious. We then had Rabo de Toro--bull tails--only instead of being served with the bone, the meat was pared from the bone and then shaped into a pleasing circle. Again, the sauce was delicious. For dessert we had the souffle de Turron. Normally, we are not big fans of souffles, but this too was amazing. A great way to finish the evening. The wine we had was a Ribera del Duero--Hacienda Monasterio. Smooth and full bodied. We highly recommend it. To top the evening off, the chef came by our table and we had a very nice chat. He is an artist in the kitchen and a real gentleman. This restaurant is a must if you are in Madrid. Also, request a table near the kitchen so that you can watch the magic of the attention to detail and the precision that goes into preparing the dishes.

review_full: I was walking by and saw the sign Michelin guide 1 star. I said to myself, let’s cancel the resevation at la primera ( amazing restaurant ) and lets try Peruvian Food in Madrid. Forst of all, I reserved a specific table and the restaurant gave me a different one, a table with underlight bubbles that were driving everyone crazy. The service was slow, very slow, 1 waiter could not handle all the tables in the area at once.  The wine selection could not be worst. Absolutely the worst wines I have tested in Madrid.  When the food started to arrive, I could not believe that a place would serve such terrible plates. I did not return plates or left the restaurant because we were in a group of 9 people and tonight is our last night in Madrid on this trip, otherwise, I would not have hesitated. Absolutely a terrible restaurant. Do not waste your time. Nothing to think about, will never be back.

title_review: Absolutely perfect ceviche and pisco sours - the lighting is too bright!
review_preview: My ex is Peruvian so I have tried a lot of ceviche and pisco sours in my time. I've been to this restaurant on a few occasions and the ceviche (both the traditional one, and the green version with shellfish) is spectacular, and the pisco...
review_full: My ex is Peruvian so I have tried a lot of ceviche and pisco sours in my time. I've been to this restaurant on a few occasions and the ceviche (both the traditional one, and the green version with shellfish) is spectacular, and the pisco sours are among the best I've ever had . I actually think the food is better here than in A&G in nearby Salamanca. My only criticism is the lighting - it's too bright! I find this is an issue with so many restaurants in Madrid. Dim the lights, and this restaurant would be perfect. It would make the meal so much more cosy and intimate.

title_review: An Exotic Culinary Journey to Peru
review_preview: Amazing, unique food and drinks from Peru in a beautiful modern setting decorated with Peruvian pottery!   The very friendly and accommodating staff made room for us by the bar in front when we happened upon it on Spain's national holiday - all the regular tables...
review_full: Amazing, unique food and drinks from Peru in a beautiful modern setting decorated with Peruvian pottery! The very friendly and accommodating staff made room for us by the bar in front when we happened upon it on Spain's national holiday - all the regular tables had been reserved. The food is totally unique, highlighting the food products and national cuisine of Peru; don't forget to ask about Peruvian drinks - alcoholic and non-alcoholic. The super-friendly staff were happy to explain everything on the menu (in Spanish), and to serve us so we could share all of the different things we tried. The décor is simple but beautiful, and much care is taken to present a totally lovely aesthetic experience, not merely a magnificent culinary one. Dishes are artfully served on lovely tableware. It is not cheap, but still is good value for a super-special culinary experience.

title_review: One of the best restaurants I have ever visited
review_preview: My friends and I visited here on a Saturday night. Simply put, it was absolutely fantastic. Firstly, the menu is Peruvian in style yet there are some excellent, very tasty, options aside from just the basic ceviche. We asked the very helpful waiter for some...
review_full: My friends and I visited here on a Saturday night. Simply put, it was absolutely fantastic. Firstly, the menu is Peruvian in style yet there are some excellent, very tasty, options aside from just the basic ceviche. We asked the very helpful waiter for some suggestions of what to order, and we ordered a range of starters alongside the classic ceviche and the prawns. Each dish was superbly presented and the flavours were divine. We drank pisco sours and a very nice red wine, and they complimented the meal perfectly. The service was fantastic, and it's a lovely atmosphere inside. Sophisticated, yet charming. I really cannot put into words just how much we enjoyed it. I am already planning my next visit for when I'm next in Madrid!

review_preview: Even though was pretty late and kitchen already closed, Mr Giuseppe decided to cook for me. It was my lucky day: I had the chance to eat a marvellous Spaghetti ai frutti di mare ( pasta seafood). As an Italian, I am rather skeptical when...
review_full: Even though was pretty late and kitchen already closed, Mr Giuseppe decided to cook for me. It was my lucky day: I had the chance to eat a marvellous Spaghetti ai frutti di mare ( pasta seafood). As an Italian, I am rather skeptical when it comes to eating Italian abroad but I have to admit that the experience in La Piccola Trattoria made up my mind: each ingredient - starting from the pasta (handmade) to the musses (very fresh) - was delicious and even the presentation of the plate was impeccable. Not to mention the culan with pistacchio (woooow). I have the luck to live next to this cozy restaurant and Mr Giuseppe will see me every other day, but for those of you who want to see an experienced and passionate Italian chef in action I’d suggest to reserve one of the few table available. Ah, and don’t worry about the bill, you’ll receive an affordable surprise at the end ( yes, you got it: high quality and low price !!! )

Maybe we came in on a day they were short staffed, because there was only one girl working (who seemed really sweet but we speak primarily English and she spoke primarily Spanish so there was definitely a big language barrier and we couldn’t understand much). We ordered the tuna dip for an appetizer (which was good but definitely just tuna out of a cab with mayo and some other stuff along with tortilla chips from a bag thrown on a plate). We then got 4 different tacos. My boyfriend said it appeared that the girl was pulling meat out of prepackaged bags, like they were just store bought pre made meats. The tacos came and they were pretty underwhelming. We got the chicken mole one, I really didn’t like that one, it also was basically just a pile of mushy sauce, barely any chicken and had a weird flavor in my opinion. The two pork ones, pastor and another one I forget, weren’t bad but the slow cooked pork looked pretty unappetizing to me. Overall I was sadly pretty disappointed with this place and don’t really understand how it got such good ratings. Thinking maybe we ordered the wrong stuff? But it was all pretty disappointing so I’m not sure.

I ate pizza and even though it was good it did not marked me either ... Now I want to go back to try the pasta, which seems to be the great specialty of this place. Friendly and attentive service, nice pugliese cook who comes out from time to time from his kitchen to lend a hand. To repeat.

title_review: Excellent authentic Italian food and great service
review_preview: La Piccola Trattoria is a small restaurant with 4 tables (you will not find a table unless you reserve several days in advance). We had Burrata (which you could easily share with 4 people, we were 2). Then we had Fagottini with Gorgonzola, pears, toasted...
review_full: La Piccola Trattoria is a small restaurant with 4 tables (you will not find a table unless you reserve several days in advance). We had Burrata (which you could easily share with 4 people, we were 2). Then we had Fagottini with Gorgonzola, pears, toasted almonds, amaretto and truffle, as well as Raviolacci with Boletus mushrooms. We barely managed to eat everything, but did so anyway because it was so delicious. The service was excellent. We will definitely eat there again (and many more times)!

title_review: Good.....if you like to wait and wait and wait
review_preview: Just left establishment and pretty upset that after 1.5 hours our original order was not fulfilled.  Got to El Rey around 8:45 PM looking forward to try some Mexican food after being in Madrid for a few days.....that spicy spirit calls unto you in mysterious...
review_full: Just left establishment and pretty upset that after 1.5 hours our original order was not fulfilled. Got to El Rey around 8:45 PM looking forward to try some Mexican food after being in Madrid for a few days.....that spicy spirit calls unto you in mysterious and profound ways. Waitress was friendly and promptly took our drink and food order. Our horchatas (rice drink) were definitely not homemade and very much powder based. The only good thing about the horchatas were that they came out within the first five minutes of ordering.  The place is very small and with only a handful of patrons...5 to be exact.....we waited and waited and waited and waited. Finally after 45 minutes, we received our appetizer of queso fundido with rajas. There was plenty to be desired here as it was melted cheddar that quickly hardened, topped with slices of poblano and onions, along with kernels of corn. 10 minutes later, we finally get ONLY a portion of our order. In case you’re not keeping track, this is 55 minutes after we placed our order!!! We, party of 2, ordered 3 tacos each....2 cochinito pibil, 2 tinga de pollo and 2 carnitas. We only got 4, sans carnitas. Waitress acknowledged it wasn’t full order and would be bringing the rest out soon. What about the taste you ask? Well, the cochinita pibil was really flavorful though the corn tortillas it was on didn’t do it justice. Can’t say the same of the chicken. You will see that they use THE MICROWAVE quite a bit here. Tortillas were dry and brittle, which made the taco fall apart instantly, and not in the way where juices are running down your fingers, consuming you in Mexican ecstasy my friends. More like when your chubby cousin really wants to look good in a skinny Aeropostale T-shirt but nothing is held in. Love you primo!! We finally get our last two tacos, but what is this??? More tinga de pollo tacos?!?! And not my favorite of the two I must say! Waitress took the tacos back and while she and the “cook” tried to sort it out, we decided to cancel the last of the order as it was after 10 pm at this point. No apologies, and in fact the “cook” seemed offended we cancelled as she said she was about to heat up the tacos....meaning tortillas in the microwave.  1 star for the waitress who really was friendly and another for the cochinita pibil.

review_preview: In America we would call this place a “hole in the wall” restaurant where often you find some of the best, most authentic food. However, this was more of a bar first and taqueria second. It wasn’t the best Mexican food, but it was good...
review_full: In America we would call this place a “hole in the wall” restaurant where often you find some of the best, most authentic food.  However, this was more of a bar first and taqueria second. It wasn’t the best Mexican food, but it was good - and they have a fun way of presenting the tacos.  The tacos are small (like CD sized) and you order them individually. I ordered four. The best was the pork with marinated onions. The worst was the chicken - it was dry and hard like it was cooked and left out all day.  I would try a few more Mexican restaurants before coming back here. I would not want this to be my first choice.

review_preview: While in Madrid for a few days in mid-May 2019, my wife and I stopped in here for lunch on a Wednesday.  The place was busy, but we found a table, and a waiter brought us an English menu almost immediately. We ordered two glasses...
review_full: While in Madrid for a few days in mid-May 2019, my wife and I stopped in here for lunch on a Wednesday. The place was busy, but we found a table, and a waiter brought us an English menu almost immediately. We ordered two glasses of sangria and two empanadas, one cheese and onion (queso y cebollo), and one Arabian style (estilo de Arabe). The sangria was wonderful, with the requisite slices of fresh lemon and fresh orange. While both empanadas were good, the clear winner was the Arabian style. It had finely ground meat (lamb?) subtly favored with many spices. Delicious! Service was prompt and attentive; we ordered five minutes after we arrived, and 2 minutes after that we had our sangrias, and 5 minutes after that we had hot and freshly made empanadas at the table. Our bill was €12.40, a good price for a great light lunch. This place is very well located if you are staying at the Urban Sea Atocha 113 hotel (reviewed elsewhere here on TA); it was a five-minute walk.  We stopped in again the next day for a second meal, this time around 6pm. We had the ham and cheese (jamon y queso) empanada and the chicken (pollo) empanada, two sangrias, and a sparkling water. While both empanadas, split between us, were very good, we thought the pollo was the better of the two. Our bill this time was €15, which seemed fair to us for a good dinner. So, our overall empanada ratings: The Arabian was best, followed by the chicken, followed by the cheese and onion, followed by the jamon y queso. That said, all four were excellent. Don’t miss this place!

I really enjoyed our visit, waiter was polite and friendly and understood the broken Spanish and english.

title_review: Still the best quality/value in Madrid
review_preview: I hadn't been here for a few years but can report that the food is still the best value for money in Madrid. The location has changed, a bigger place now but not too big. El Cogollo has won best "cachopo" in Madrid in the...
review_full: I hadn't been here for a few years but can report that the food is still the best value for money in Madrid. The location has changed, a bigger place now but not too big. El Cogollo has won best "cachopo" in Madrid in the past. This year they won best in all of Spain. I had cachopo(thin sliced veal with jamón, cheese, deep fried in delicate batter. Delicious. Couldn't eat it all but you can ask for a container to take the excess back home or to your hotel. 5 minutes walk from Sol. Good, friendly service. Highly recommended.

We shared a number of dishes - all delicious - squid croquettes, ham, tuna salad, breaded veal with ham and cheese. More than enough to eat and reasonably priced. Good wine by the glass. review_full: Our family of three had dinner here based on TA reviews and proximity to our hotel. Service here was the most friendly that we have experienced in Spain so far and the food was really good! Our group tried three different tacos: mole con pollo, tinga de pollo, and cochinita pibil. The favorite were the cochinita pibil. Margaritas were also very good (6 Euros). Tacos are priced at approximately 1.5 Euros each. We would recommend it for a casual, quick dinner with very good service! Note: our Spanish is at an intermediate level, our server who spoke no English was very sweet and patient with our minor language barrier.

review_preview: Fabulous place with a level of service that is second to none. My take on the food served here is that it’s very good but it’s not fantastic. There were a couple of flaws that I detected. The dishes are not overly creative (giving that...
review_full: Fabulous place with a level of service that is second to none. My take on the food served here is that it’s very good but it’s not fantastic. There were a couple of flaws that I detected. The dishes are not overly creative (giving that this is Spain so the bar is very high) and the value for money in my opinion is on the declining side of things. That being be said I have no doubts this place has all of the merits for its only Michelin star. Why not two? At first sight you would think so, especially for the quality of the service, but maybe the judges are seeing the same things as I did re the food. Will I come back? Yes. Will I repeat on the same dishes? Definitely not.

title_review: A bit disappointed but great atmosphere
review_preview: Went there with my family as a group of 13 people for my mum’s birthday. The restaurant prepared a room without charging us extra. Service was great but could be better if the servers could realise that I am left-handed and rearrange the table setting...
review_full: Went there with my family as a group of 13 people for my mum’s birthday. The restaurant prepared a room without charging us extra. For foods, we went for a la carte because most of us are small eaters. Since the restaurant emphasised on its local natural ingredients, I feel like for both my entree (egg from Mos, roe of Choco) and main dish (tuna) were a bit over salted. The sauce and dressing don’t compliment the food. Its probably just me who didn’t enjoy the food. The rest seemed to enjoy their foods. I tried my mum’s waffle or foie. It was exceptional.

title_review: Great Food & Drink In A Tastefully Decorated Environment
review_preview: A great option to visit for both food and drinks. I went there on Wednesday and we had a fantastic selection of tapas: an amazing fresh burrata in a bed of salmorejo, a tomato, avocado and mango salad, a deliciously fresh octopus in a bed...
review_full: A great option to visit for both food and drinks. I went there on Wednesday and we had a fantastic selection of tapas: an amazing fresh burrata in a bed of salmorejo, a tomato, avocado and mango salad, a deliciously fresh octopus in a bed of potato pure... all of it extremely tasty! The drinks are very reasonably priced, at 7€ a cocktail, and the bar becomes lively in the later stages of the evening, with a DJ that plays en eclectic mix of international music. Strongly recommend it!!

title_review: Great atmosphere but opportunities to improve the taste
review_preview: Once you get there, the owners will be taking care of you. You will find Venezuelan and Mexican food.We tried the breakfast empanadas which were OK and cachapas con queso de mano, also ok.I was surprised with the cachapa price. It costs 9,50...
review_full: Once you get there, the owners will be taking care of you.  You will find Venezuelan and Mexican food. We tried the breakfast empanadas which were OK and cachapas con queso de mano, also ok. I was surprised with the cachapa price. It costs 9,50 eur but it is not worth it once you get it, in my opinion it is extremely overpriced. For that price I was expecting something bigger and tastier. Juices are very good, don't know if they are natural though. The place is very clean, service is very good. Waiters super kind. You get the feeling that it was built with love, but there are opportunities to improve in terms of taste of the food, at least what we tried.
